results.title: Politics: Soviet style
results.creator_credit: David Brownlow, Arch Nicholson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A brief history of politics in Russia prior to the Revolution in 1917, through the leadership of Lenin and Stalin, into the 1970’s. Identifies the Communist Party as the source of ultimate power and attempts to explain party organisation. Photography is by Dean Semler and narration by Margaret Throsby. Suitable for secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Brownlow, Arch Nicholson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia

results.title: The People's music: Soviet style
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Russian Education”.
Contains eleven examples of Soviet citizens engaged in making music. Ranges from kindergarten children in Minst singing and dancing a traditional folk song to the highly respected professional group, the Kuban Cossack Choir and the Veryovka Folk Ensemble. Photographer, Dean Semler; script, Roger Milliss; editor, Martyn Down; sound, George Hart, Howard Spry; commentator, Margaret Throsby.

results.title: School's in, Soviet style
results.creator_credit: Martyn Down, Arch Nicholson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Russian Education”.
Examines the present school system in the Soviet Union. Demonstrates the style of Soviet teaching which is fairly rigid and formal, with the emphasis on teacher dominated instruction and passive pupils, responding only when instructed to do so. A more flexible teaching style was introduced some years ago but was later abandoned. Photographer, Dean Semler; script, Roger Milliss; editor, Martyn Down; sound, George Hart, Howard Spry; commentator, Margaret Throsby.

results.title: Working: Soviet style
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson, Tom Manefield and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Soviet style”.
A look at the Soviet economy in the 1970’s. Examines some of the Industrial developments, investigates output, productivity, the relationships between management and the trade unions, and management and individual workers. Also examines working conditions and salaries in a coal mine, a refrigerator factory, a timber processing complex, and dock workers in Odessa

results.title: Science international. No. 2. The last scourge
results.creator_credit: Aubrey F Singer, Humphrey Fisher and BBC-TV
results.brief_description: A report on the world-wide investigations into the origins of life, as revealed in the study of the cell, and progress in the battle against cancer. British, American, French and Russian scientists tell of current lines of research into the origins of cancer in the light of what has already been discovered about the cell. The clinical aspects of cancer are not dealt with.
